body_html:
Ah OK. yes i was about to say that :) it's a structure that is as
functional as possible; if you don't use the return value it skips the
write.

On Thu, Oct 27, 2016 at 8:56 AM, Davit Buniatyan notifications@github.com
wrote:

Ok, problem is now resolved sorry for disturbance. @ebrevdo
https://github.com/ebrevdo I haven't noticed that TensorArray.write
actually returns a new array so basically I was supposed to reassign
loop_state on every write. Thank you very much.

—
You are receiving this because you were mentioned.

body:
Ah OK.  yes i was about to say that :)  it's a structure that is as
functional as possible; if you don't use the return value it skips the
write.

On Thu, Oct 27, 2016 at 8:56 AM, Davit Buniatyan notifications@github.com
wrote:

> Ok, problem is now resolved sorry for disturbance. @ebrevdo
> https://github.com/ebrevdo I haven't noticed that TensorArray.write
> actually returns a new array so basically I was supposed to reassign
> loop_state on every write. Thank you very much.
>
